meanings.definition: To remove from a case or covering.
meanings.sent1: I will uncase the phone to check for any damage.
meanings.sent2: Please uncase the jewelry before trying it on.
meanings.sent3: As the detective uncase the evidence, the truth slowly emerged.
meanings.sent4: Her smile uncase the joy hidden within her heart.
meanings.sent5: The magician's trick was to uncase a rabbit from his hat.

meanings.definition: To reveal or expose something previously hidden or protected.
meanings.sent1: The archaeologist carefully uncase the ancient artifact.
meanings.sent2: The storm uncase the buried treasure on the beach.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected gust of wind uncase the picnic blanket, causing a commotion.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter uncase the happiness she had been holding back.
meanings.sent5: The sunrise uncase the beauty of the landscape, painting it in golden light.
